etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Society of Arts. From Italian reticello reticella lace, mesh pattern as a kind of glass decoration, specifically uses of reticello small net from rete net + -cello, diminutive suffix

definitions: A type of Venetian glass having a decorative mesh pattern or patterns of fine glass threads embedded inside.
The decorative mesh pattern of fine glass threads embedded in such glass.
